titles.title: To make clear that the definition of a base period, under the unemployment compensation law of a State, is not an administrative provision subject 303(a)(1) of the Social Security Act.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 7/11/1996--Introduced. Declares that the definition of a base period, under the unemployment compensation law of a State, is not an administrative provision subject to a Social Security Act requirement that methods of administration must be found by the Secretary of Labor to be reasonably calculated to insure full payment of unemployment compensation when due. (Provides that, for purposes of this Act, "base period" and "State law" have the same meanings as under the Federal-State Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 1970.)
